Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel for a trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: ale3andro
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice if you travel to Venice and cannot afford a room in the main island. It is located far from the lagoon but the public transportation for Venice is excellent. Our room at the sixth floor was spacious, clean and new. An excellent room. There is also a free hotel parking. The downside was that the internet was down for one of the three days we stayed but that's something that could happen everywhere. If you decide to book this hotel in order to visit Venice you should know a couple of things about commuting to Venice and back beforehand. There is a train station (Ve. Mestre Ospedale) close to the hotel and from there you can catch a direct train to the Venice Santa Lucia train station for as low as 2.5 euro for the a round trip. The reception stuff was very helpfull to assist as in finding the train station and they aslo gave as a paper with the train and buses timetables. That was very convenient. Just note that in Ve. Mestre Ospedale train station you will not find an automatic ticket vending machine so you should buy tickets before going to the station or board in the first vagon and buy them directly from the train stuff. Another option is a direct shuttle from the hotel to Venice Piazzale di Roma for 10 euro (for a round trip) but it is not available every day, so check with the reception for availability.

Reviews.Title: “It is not so good option for visiting venezia”
Reviews.Author: mistralksk
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because other reviews show it as a good alternative to the expensive hotels in Veneze, but I regret choosing it. The Hotel is outside of Mestre, in a shopping centre area, absolutely soulless in the nights and Sundays. To go to Venize you have to take a bus (bus stop close to the hotel) or a train (station ten minutes walking) plus another train in Mestre Central Station. It took me almost two hours to go to Venize on Sunday morning, and keep in mind that trains from Central to Venize are overcrowded. The hotel is modern; rooms are small, minimalism designed but far a way from their parent hotels Boscolo. You have to pay for wifi, although in my room there was not signal and I had to go to the lobby. The worst was the breakfast buffet; there was not fresh fruit or fresh juices, and the quality in general was poor. As there were not enough tables, some guests were asked to share table: inappropriate for a four stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Very good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Luis C
Reviews.Content: It is a very Nice new hotel with nice people. Near by Veneci, with bus stop, train And supermarket and with a lot of choise to eat. They have a good restaurant with a Very good good And excellent rooms. A Nice place to stay. Luis

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy experience!”
Reviews.Author: Puggle_12
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out we found this hotel to be very poor in quality and service. We were part of a tour group and staying for two nights. On arrival we waited for over half an hour while they sorted out the fiasco that was meant to have been our booking. The room we were allocated to triple share with our adult son was so cramped we could hardly move around, and the 'bed' he was expected to sleep in was nothing but a fold out chair and no wider than a hospital trolley! On asking if we could be re-allocated we were told that they were overbooked and could do nothing about it! To top it all off the shower head in our room was broken and on reporting it they finally arrived - with a roll of masking tape - and proceeded to wrap a fist sized wad of tape around it to hold it up. We found the staff to be quite rude and unhelpful. I had been told that Italian people were very friendly and hospitable - not the case at this hotel! Would never stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Finding the hotel is quite the mission!”
Reviews.Author: iczi
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to save some money by staying outside of Venice because we were there during the Film Festival, and found the difference in price about $200-300USD! We thought we had a steal until we got there. The guide from the hotel website of reaching from the airport was vague and confusing. We arrived at the Venice airport at 10:30pm and had trouble finding a shuttle that would take us to Mestre, which claims to be 15 mins away. The shuttle was 5EUR and took about half an hour which only took us to the Mestre train station. We decided it was too scary to venture so we took a cab, which we were sure we were taken advantage of because it took another 15 mins and cost 28EUR. Cabs in Venice starts at 7.95 EUR by the way. It was a nice surprise once we got there - modern clean designs, wide open concepts and check-in went with little hiccups. Diego was extremely rude but everyone else we encountered were friendly and helpful. Wireless works on the 9th floor (gym/pool/lounge) and lobby at 1EUR for the day. Rooms were new and shiny and clean. Everything was better in the morning, we walked 15 mins to the near by suburban shopping mall with a huge supermarket within it. The bus to Venice is located AT the mall, not outside the hotel, which we didn't find out because the staff didn't clarify, so we had to go back and forth for a bit. The tickets had to be purchased at a cigar shop/cafe, and it is only 1.50 EUR to head to Piazza Roma in Venice. Breakfast was ok, a good spread but nothing amazing, fills you up for a long day ahead though. A lot of Asian tour groups were staying there, so a good idea is to probably get breakfast before 7am to avoid that huge influx of people. The rooftop "pool" was probably 3 bathtubs big but the decor was very nice, with comfortable lounge chairs all around. This is definitely not a "relaxing" hotel but more of an "overnight before Venice" kind of hotel. Most people here are on tour groups or on their way into Venice for a cruise. Overall, although the rooms are nice, I would recommend staying at a lower star rating hotel withIN Venice rather than going through all that trouble to get here. Located in the suburbs it is not tourist friendly at all in terms of convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: alanyeo76
Reviews.Content: Stayed the the b4 hotel outside Venice. The hotel is new and it had a swimming pool and gym. There is a shopping mall near the hotel, about 10-15 minutes walk away, with a huge supermarket located within the mall itself. Rooms are clean and new. Bed is comfortable and connected internet access Â is available in the room. Wifi is only available in the public areas which cost 1 euro per 24hrs slot. Tv in the room is small though. Breakfast in the hotel is average, not much selection but I would say that it is good enough as they have scrambled eggs, croissants and bacon and ham.Â  There is a bar right beside the reception area where one can stop for a coffee or wine, beer.

Reviews.Title: “awful experience -- be careful with your possessions”
Reviews.Author: Bert J
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we had a horrible experience at this hotel and later found the hotel management extremely unhelpful. During our stay in late July this year, a large amount of cash (worth about 480 euros) disappeared from my wifeâ€™s wallet. We discovered the loss/theft soon after we left the hotel and were ready to board a cruise ship. We concluded that the money could only have been stolen while my wife left her handbag at the hotel on two occasions, as all the credit cards etc were intact in the wallet in the handbag, and the handbag was with her all the time after we left the hotel. We quickly reported the theft to the security staff at Veniceâ€™s sea port and (following advice from them) later formally to the police in Bari when we moored the following day. We called the hotel manager as soon as we came back to London and submitted all the evidence (including the declaration to the police). The manager assured us that they would investigate what could have happened, and contact their own insurer. We were reassured that we would find out the result of the investigation and the insurer would also get in touch. We have patiently waited and waited, wrote to them again and again, and they simply ignored us â€“ not picking up phone calls or responding to emails. When we visited the hotel, it appeared to be used by some far eastern tour groups, who tend to stay only for a night or so. My worry is that if the hotel canâ€™t be responsible for the safety of guestsâ€™ possessions, how can one feel safe staying in the hotel. We are frequent travellers and have visited many hotels in many countries, but this has really been the worst experience we have had. Be careful with your possessions, if you are determined to stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!”
Reviews.Author: beth c
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews i thought the hotel was owed a more positive review for the clean, modern fantastic service it offers. The location IS in venice but not the heart of venice it is a borough of venizia called mestre. Its around a 30 min bus ride but the public transport is easily accessible pleasant ( air conditioned) and regular. I dont agree with previous comments about a ' industrial estate' its a modern built up area which is a total contrast of the fairy tale venice but i wouldnt say it was bad. There is a shopping centre over the road with food and shops. also a train station which goes direct to venice in 10 mins. The Hotel was extremly clean and modern. There was free internet a pool and gym. The pool was small and un swimable but it was still pleasent to sit on the roof top or relax in the hot sun in the pool. The restaurant and bar were beautiful with modern seating and lovely food and drinks offerd. Our room was cleaned daily and beds changed and made. We experience no loud noise or bad experiences what so ever, I would reccomend this hotel maybee to the younger generation as its modern and a total contrast to venice but me and my partner found it nice to have the normality of a normal holiday destination in italy or the magical city of venice. The only 1 problem is that you had to return from venice at 12 am as that was the last train but other than that A* There is no air port transportation direct however ryan air offer a shuttle from treviso airport to mestre for about 5 euro return. You are dropped at the train station and can get a train from there to mestre ospedal which is directly opposite the hotel. If its out of hours and theres no transport a taxi was about 14 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever...”
Reviews.Author: Carina1601
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the B4 during a romantic getaway as Lastminute.com claimed it to be Top Secret fantastic hotel ''just outside'' of Venice. Turned out to be a 40 minutes drive to Venice and 20 minutes by train. I don't think it helped that there happened to be a national strike on transports that same week... This hotel is in the middle of an industrial estate and when the receptionist said to me that he upgraded us to a garden view room, I was delighted to have a view on a hardware store and Auchan !!! The staff are rude, and they all seem to give you different information about transports etc. The roof top pool is ridiculously small and the ''fitness centre'' is a joke! The glass around the swimming pool was smashed to pieces ( I took pictures!) Boscolo hotels have a very good reputation (see my review about the New York Palace in Budapest) which is being let down big time by this hotel. I blame Lastminute.com for this bad experience which was thankfully quickly forgotten as soon as we managed to make our way into Venice, a magical place. Just one advice then: if you go to venice, stay in Venice !

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel, outside of city”
Reviews.Author: mwall722
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a weekend trip with a friend to Venice. We chose this place based on TA reviews and the fact that we wanted to save a little money by staying off of the island. The public transportation was pretty convenient, unless you plan on staying in the City late, in which case yu will need to take a cab back, which runs approx. 35 euros. The bus stop is pretty much right outside the door from the hotel and runs from early in the morning (7AM?) to approximately 7PM. There are other options other than bus directly from Venice to the hotel, but this is by far the most convenient and economical (2.50 each way!) The rooms and lobby were very modern and look to have been recently renovated. Breakfast was included in our rate and was fairly typical spread for European breakfast, although I will say I have had better, but it was enough to get us by until we were in the city and could grab some delicious Venetian cuisine. There is also a restaurant near the lobby, which we ate at on our last night, which was average when compared to the great city food, but was pretty much the only option in the area. Overall, a good choice if you want to spend the days walking around the city and just need a nice place to crash at night. Parking was also free, which was a nice bonus. Also, rooftop pool and fitness area was nice, however we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KentDee
Reviews.Content: Sadly quite a 'souless' hotel for its calibre- no nice chairs to enjoy a drink- too far out of Venice! It was a 'secret location' hotel and was not of the same calibre as UK. If you want to return to the hotel early eveing then the transportation service is not bad and 2 buses will get you back to outside the hotel. However as we wanted to see Venice by day and night then it cost us to use the taxi service. We also paid over the top arriving at the station to get a taxi to the hotel- DO NOT PAY MORE THAN 25 euros. Despite asking for the most direct route this clearly didn't happen. We were trying to do Venice on a bidget- my tip is save the transportation money and find something in the Venice centre.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: Joobert
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for one night during the first week of September 2011. Like the title indicates, the hotel was just average. There was no "wow factor" to it, nor was it bad. Location: As with many airport hotels, this hotel was located in a quiet area, on the outskirts of Mestre. This being said, there is nothing in the vicinity of great interest. However, there is a small strip mall (Auchan) located nearby (~10 minute walking distance). The mall includes a supermarket that is very Walmart-esque. There you will find everything from booze, to toiletries, to even electronics. Room: The room (and hotel itself) was very clean and modern. Although the room was a bit on the small side, it served it's purpose if you're looking for a comfortable place to lay your head. Service: The service was, again, nothing special. When we arrived late at night, we were barely greeted at the check-in desk by a gentleman named 'Diego'. Although he was not rude with us, it almost seemed as if he was doing us a favour and that we were a nuisance to him. Aside from that, we didn't really encounter any other hotel staff members. The breakfast buffet that was included in our package was, again, just fine. Dishes and cutlery were clean, the food was plentiful and there was room to find and sit at a table without bumping into another table. Nothing to write home about, yet nothing to complain about. Overall Thoughts: If you find this hotel for a very good price, and are looking for a one night stay (e.g. heading to Venezia the next day, as soon as you wake up), then you really have nothing to lose. The hotel is clean, quiet and provides (if it's included in your package) a solid breakfast for the day. Just don't expect to be blown away.

Reviews.Title: “very nice but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: HicksWinnipeg44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of the Trafalar bus tour. Hotel is in the industrial area so a little far from the action. Rooms very nice and clean. If you have never had to use your room card to get lights to go on and stay on it was a work in progress. Beds comfortable and the bathroom clean and well stock with everything we needed. Had a breakfast buffet, which did not have a big variety and scrambled eggs watery. Staff very good and friendly. Would recommend this hotel if you want to be in quite area.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but not in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jchispas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the B4 Mestre hotel from lastminute.com. It was their "top secret" special so you don't find out what the hotel is until you have paid. It was "top secret" because it is impossible to find! Getting there on public transport for the first time was very difficult and took us almost 2 hours! We knew that it was not in the heart of Venice but it said it was just 10 minutes out of the city and that there was plenty of public transport. That was false advertising. It takes about 40 minutes to get to Venice and the buses stop at 7pm. That said, the bus stop is about 30 seconds from the hotel so at least that part is convenient. The trains run until 10pm. If you don't mind the commute however it is a good place to stay. It is clean and comfortable. The beds are incredibly comfortable and because you are in the middle of nowhere it is very quiet at night. The service was also quite good. I sprained my ankle in Venice and the front desk staff were very helpful in getting me ice and directions to the hospital etc. The pool is more like an oversized bathtub, maybe they ran out of financing? Don't expect a nice swim at the end of the day but the deck area is nice. The hotel itself is quite good, and of course much better value than staying in Venice. However if you are going to Venice, why not stay in Venice? We are backpacking, on a budget and did not plan far enough in advance in our hotel booking which is why we stayed at the B4 and by the time we left we were quite pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Breakfast Rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Froggitt
Reviews.Content: Room was fine, reception very helpful, however charging â‚¬60 for four for breakfast, which was a cup of coffee, toast, cordial, and cereal, was a ripoff......only told the cost at the end of the meal. We had a meal for four including wine outside the hotel the previous evening for the same amount.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay at this hotel if you want to enjoy venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: rjeLondon
Reviews.Content: i booked this hotel through lastminute.com as a celebratory treat for myself and my wife it bills itself as aluxury design hotel 15 mins from venice.in reality it is a converted office block in a grimy industrial estate on the outskirts of mestre. the local attractions consist of an auchan shopping mall,mcdonalds and a do it yourself superstore. one of the reasons for booking was because of its 24 hour state of the art fitness facility and rooftop pool !! what a joke! the pool is 6mts long and 1.5 mtrs wide big enough for one person to paddle around for a while ! ,the safety glass around the pool had been smashed and there was glass all over the floor for the duration of our four day stay. the gym consists of a broken exercise bike and 3 extremely lightweight and cheap treadmills and one set of of 2kg dumbells!!!! there was a public transport strike on while we were there and the staff were extremely unhelpfull when it came to obtaining information and were only interested in pushing the services of there own overpriced personal drivers. we were told we could not have coffee unless we paid 30 euros for breakfast ! the worst hotel location and worst service i have ever experienced ! in fairness it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Feef50
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a Trafalgar Tour, would have been the worst hotel of the trip. The hotel was new and clean but the food was terrible and the staff had no idea what they were doing. The staff in the restaurant were extremely rude. The dinner was discusting both nights.

Reviews.Title: “Rude restaurant staff”
Reviews.Author: dominictom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our tour. The hotel is new and very clean. However the restaurant staff are quite rude during our dinner, they were not very enthusiastic in serving our second round of drinks. The staff came in late next morning to serve breakfast and we were left waiting. When another group of guests who were supposed to have later breakfast, came in at the same time and and took our breakfast, the staff did not intervene. We will consider returning to this hotel in future, but the restaurant staff need training.

Reviews.Title: “We will NEVER be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaeveKeaveney
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in alot of Hotels around he world of various degrees of comfort - this hotel's service (or lack thereof) was appalling. We opted to eat in the restaurant (which looked lovely) only to be rudely ushered to our table. The waiters were shockingly stupid and basically to sum up what could be a description of lenghty proportions of the disasterous sequence of events...... the head waitress decided that considering the embarrasing level of service and the poor quality of food she could only charge us â‚¬15 per person including drinks!!! There were 5 people manning reception each more useless than the next and they were all just standing around with hands in pockets shrugging shoulders while we waited to be checked-in. They couldn't answer simple questions such as what amenities were available locally - where their hotel was in relation to the airport.... they had to google and print a map...!!! I discovered there were feather pillows on the bed and my husband is allergic to feathers (fairly common...) so I rang down to reception and requested 4 replacement pillows. The person was shocked when I requested 4 pillows and repeated it at least 5 times times..." 4 Pillows? 4.... 4 Pillows - You want 4 pillows...?? " Someone knocked on our door an HOUR later with 2 pillows.... I didn't have it in me to argue..... On the night before our departure we carefully completed our breakfast room-service menu request and placed it on the door handle (as you do). They didn't bother to take it so we were furious and hungry the next morning and all they could do was apologise for forgetting to collect it!! we missed breakfast (that we had paid for...) as we had to catch a flight quite early and had no time. We would NEVER go back or use ANY hotels associated to this hotel. And with all due respect - we are not fussy, so that says ALOT!!! The bed was comfortable though!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but too far from EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: dabearsfan007
Reviews.Content: Pros - good breakfast, clean room, modern look Con - Location, location, location We used points to purchase the hotel. The hotel is a nice hotel, quiet, and modern looking. However, it is out in the middle of nowhere. It is about a 20 minute bus ride from Venezia Mestre train station and 45 minutes from Venice canals. There are no instructions on what bus to take or how to get there which was frustrating. Please note that when coming back from the canals, bus 24H does not run past 7:10pm. You have to go back to the train station on the main land (bus 2), then catch another bus to the hotel (H2). Once at the hotel, there is a bus station about 40 feet from the entrance which is nice. The hotel staff was very informative on how to get around and to get to the canals. Breakfast is very good and has a lot of variety. The room is small, but modern looking and quiet. Overall a nice stay other than the location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, terrible breakfast”
Reviews.Author: OzSweDe
Reviews.Content: The positive: good beds, cheap but stylish furniture, spacious rooms, but... The service is terrible. I tried to get a shirt ironed in the morning, but it is only possible in the evening. When asked if I could use the ironing room, the answer was a simple "No.". I explained that I had an important business meeting and the answer was still "No.". In the evening, I got the shirt ironed (6 Euro) and it was still wrinkled and with spots on it. The breakfast is "budget" and with a limited selection. The tables are not cleared and it feels chaotic. Forget a peaceful cappucino in the morning here. In the evening, we were 15 guests waiting to be served a beer in the bar, but there were no bar staff. The receptionists could see us waiting, but still did not call for someone or served us. 30 minutes later a waiter served us. After serving us, he left the bar...

Reviews.Title: “Can we have some service please?! (scowl) Ce!”
Reviews.Author: keentosee
Reviews.Content: I have never been made more unwelcome in any hotel in any country i have stayed in. This is not a big isssue if we did not have to spend much time roaming the hallways. However, considering that this hotel is located in the middle of an industrial estate, with nothing but an italian version of B & Q to keep you occupied, there is not much choice on what you can do. Drinking at the bar can only be described as a challenge, You will have to wait for about half an hour for somebody to appear, but then when they have poured your drink, they will most definatly dissapear for a futher fourty five minutes until you can have a re-fill, or even pay for your drinks. That is ofcourse if you dont mind being scowled at for asking for a drink. This ofcourse would not be a problem if the time we spent in the hotel was spent in Venice as intended, however the hotel itself is located a fourty minute bus ride from the city, this bus ride will only take you to the very edge of the city. And unless you want to catch a diffrent bus back which does not drop you off outside your hotel (which makes getting very lost very, very easy) then you will have to depart from venice sharp at 6.55pm. Leaving very little time for anybody who does not leave there hotel before miday. The city centre (st. marcs square) about 2 hours traveling from the hotel itself. Depending on how quick your legs are capable of. My advice is not to stay in this hotel unless your on business and like to sleep in early afternoon hours. Otherwise, you are wasting your time!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel : clean, modern, friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: verheuen
Reviews.Content: Though we read the negative comments on this hotel, we booked a room for 4 nights and we were very very pleased with it. The staff is more than friendly and helpfull, breakfast was good and there was always plenty of food. Everything we asked was being cared for. The location near bus and railway station was perfect for a city trip to Venezia.

Reviews.Title: “The B4 Should B 4-gotten”
Reviews.Author: plays88keys
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the B4 with a tour group in early October. How did I dislike thee? Let me count the ways... 1. It was practically impossible to bathe because of all the bathroom flaws. Let's start with the shower: it is one of those handheld shower wands with jets that stream from the side of the wand. This would not have been a problem had the container for holding the wand in place to shower not been broken, meaning if you weren't holding the wand in your hand there was nowhere to place it in the tub without shooting water everywhere. This also became a safety issue in that there was no bathmat, nor were there any slipguard strips placed in the tub. In addition, the hot and cold water mixer was broken, meaning there was either scalding water or freezing water...take your pick! It took a few times of laying down the shower wand and therefore spraying water all over the place while fiddling with the water temperature to figure this out. OK, no problem we thought - we'll take a bath instead. Only problem there was that the stopper was also broken, making a bath impossible as well. Well, we'll just take a "birdbath" in the sink then. Guess what? No stopper in the sink either. In fact, the only amenities given to us were a bottle of lotion and a bottle of shampoo. No soap. No conditioner. No showercap. NO WASHCLOTHS. Not even a box of Kleenex! As I said, bathing was impossible. 2. Entry into the room was also dicey. They have the standard electronic keycard system; unfortunately, the device where one waves the card is on the wall next to the door, and by the time you got your card away from the device and into the cardkey slot on the door, it had reset. It took us 14+ swipes to open the door...every single time we needed to get in the room.. 3. Breakfast was horrid. I mean WORST. FOOD. EVER. Unless you enjoy powdered eggs, raw bacon, canned fruit, stale croissants, "juice" that was a Tang-like powdered mix, and the worst, most undrinkable coffee ever brewed complete with powdered creamer, you are better off going hungry and eating later. Come on guys, this is ITALY, renowned the world over for wonderful food, and you're serving this junk??? Disgraceful. And about the dining room: how do you say "we don't like you - no comfort for you!" Put a prickly cactus on each table for an elegant accent, salt and pepper in individual packets (like the kind you find in a fast food establishment) instead of in shakers and have all the tables face a courtyard barren of anything except huge boulders. If they were going for a moonscape look, they nailed it. The B4 has the temerity to describe themselves as a 4 star hotel, and to be fair it was a very clean hotel, with several nice touches: a towel warmer, sturdy clothes hangers, comfortable beds and very reasonable internet charges; but given the litany of problems I listed above, I believe the overall conditions say that they don't think much of the guests they are there to serve.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nellie77
Reviews.Content: This is a very new and modern hotel. Our room was very clean and the bathroom was spacious and practical, but the dark coloured tiles made it very difficult to see in the bathroom mirror. We had a restful night's sleep as the bed was good and the room was quiet and we were able to open the window which is a plus. We stayed here with a group tour and breakfast and dinner was included. Dinner was very basic but quite enjoyable. Breakfast was another matter. Several groups descended on the breakfast room at the same time and there was just not enough food to cater for the number of guests. When items ran out, they did not seem to be replenished very promptly, if at all, and the staff seemed unable to cope with the influx. It's not like they didn't know in advance how many guests would be at breakfast! The location was quite a way out of Venice in what seemed like an industrial neighbourhood with not many facilities close by. However this wasn't a problem for us as we were on a tour and were transported everywhere on our coach. Overall a pleasant, modern hotel but the breakfast issues need to be fixed to make it a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “very modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: queenmary0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights(room422)and it is a very nice modern hotel. The rooms are abit on the small side but you are not spending all your time in the room so they were fine. The breakfast would have been nice if we could have got any, i dont think they coped very well with bus tours, but next morning we had a decent breakky. The downside to this hotel is it is 20mins from venice, that wasnt a problem for us on a bus tour, but would be for people traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: romeeza
Reviews.Content: a good hotel, has modern facilities. bathroom is great with all requirements. bed was very comfortable with modern beddings and nice decor to the room. the lift was too slow and breakfast was less than of standard. but overall it was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service - unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: nsm48
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a large group and had to fight to get our evening meal and breakfast. The service was nearly non existant and the the staff were hopeless. We gave up getting a drink with our dinner which was cold and unappetising. We had to queue for breakfast and it was very difficult to get anything to eat with a number of large groups all trying to get a meal at the same time and the staff being totally unprepared for this. The shower head was broken in most rooms making it difficult to use. I would never stay there again and would avoid a tour that did.

HotelInfo.Name: B4 Venezia-Mestre
HotelInfo.Address: Via Don Luigi Peron, 4, 30174 Venice, Italy
